page.title: 08DALRY POLITICS
page.content: A former mining community, with a high proportion of manual workers and skilled craftsmen, Dalry has always been predominantly socialist in its voting habits. {District and Regional councillors,}all {Labour,}represent Dalry on Cunninghame D.C. in Irvine and Strathclyde R.C. in Glasgow. With the recent recasting of Parliamentary constituency boundaries, the Garnock Valley was merged with North Ayrshire and Bute, a traditional Conservative seat. Consequently, Dalry is represented at{Westminster}by a {Conservative M.P.}for the first time in many years. Similarly, a boundary change has altered representation in the{European {Parliament.} However, a{Conservative} M.P. at Brussels has been replaced by a Labour M.P. for the first time.
